title: Mercury Toxicity Workup: Approach Considerations, Mercury Level Analysis, Imaging Studies
description: Mercury in any form is poisonous, with mercury toxicity most commonly affecting the neurologic, gastrointestinal (GI) and renal organ systems. Poisoning can result from mercury vapor inhalation, mercury ingestion, mercury injection, and absorption of mercury through the skin.
